headline: Cavuto: I don't buy anything they say about Ebola
subHeadline: Maybe if they weren't always telling us to stay calm, I'd be calm.

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT BARACK OBAMA
utterances.sentences: The cuts are not smart, they are not fair, they will hurt our economy. They will add hundreds of thousands of Americans to the unemployment rolls..

utterances.speaker: CONGRESSMAN STENY HOYER
utterances.sentences: The sequester will make their lives more difficult and their communities less safe.

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT BARACK OBAMA
utterances.sentences: Air traffic controllers and airport security will see cut backs

utterances.speaker: POLITICIAN
utterances.sentences: All they're saying is sequester, sequester, sequester...

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT BARACK OBAMA
utterances.sentences: Emergency responders like the ones who are here today, their ability to help respond to and recover from disasters will be degraded.

utterances.speaker: POLITICIAN
utterances.sentences: This is critical. Food and safety. What about the food that comes into our country?

utterances.speaker: CONGRESSWOMAN NANCY PELOSI
utterances.sentences: Sequester equals job loss. There's absolutely no question about that.  What happened?  I'll tell 'ya what happened. Nothing happened. The world didn't end.  Fast forward to Ebola, and these assurances the world won't end or at least humanity won't end. I'm telling 'ya, be afraid because none of this ends nicely.  Which means the world really will end.   If I'm lyin'. I'm dyin'. Or is that if they're lyin' we're all dyin'? Sometimes I forget the crisis.  But I always manage to get sick.
